Business Rules — Exposures and Reserves

Lesson
objectives

¢ Write business rules to create exposures for
specific cases

« Write business rules to create reserves for
specific cases

| Business rules Gi

¢ Manage the automated creation of

* Activities
« Exposures

« Reserves

Enable response to changing business
needs without coding

administration Ul | 4} SP cox

downtime

| Exposures — review G

) \ ¢ An exposure is a set of data used to
b (e) @ track a potential payment from one
coverage to one claimant

It is defined by the specific coverage,
claimant, and incident

Reserve lines are optional when the
exposure is created

| Reserve lines — review G

\ = Coverage: Collision

ye Claimant: Jim Means
@

COX

¢ Areserve line is an amount of money set aside for expected payments related to a
given exposure

Reserve Line 1 (vehicle damage)
Cost type: Claim Cost
Cost category: Auto body

Reserve Line 2 (auto inspection)
Cost type: Expense
Cost category: Vehicle Inspection

« Payments cannot be made without reserve lines

¢ Reserve lines are uniquely defined by exposure, cost type, and cost category

| Business rules for reserve lines G

¢ Business rules can automatically create reserve lines
¢ Business rule definitions control when and what reserve lines are created

¢ Administrators create the rules and require only limited knowledge of the
Guidewire data model

Reserve Rules

(1) Run status Name > Status > Version valid
IRRO1110-Auto Vehicle Damage Minor Staged + v

IRROL130-Auto Vehicle Damage High Staged OF v

=. IRRO1150-Multi-Region Baggage Reserve Staged OF v

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

,— — Under what conditions are exposure rules triggered?

¢
4
¢

en

Answer

_— — Under what conditions are exposure rules triggered?
, ¢
¢
The correct answer is when an incident is created, each exposure rule compares the
incident to its Applies To section and any Rule Conditions; if the incident matches, the
rule is triggered.

SS See See ease angen ses

Question

~~ — lfabusiness rule condition access the property
¢

yn exposure .VehicleIncident .AirbagsDeployed,
‘ what kind(s) of business rule can this be?

en

Answer Gi

_— — lfabusiness rule condition access the property
x exposure .VehicleIncident .AirbagsDeployed,
: what kind(s) of business rule can this be?

The correct answers are either a Reserve business rule or an Activity business rule.
Exposure creation rules can only directly access the triggering incident.

SS See See ease angen ses
